intro: Sideroxylon venulosum, commonly known as the African ironwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood that is highly valued for its durability. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by woody, spherical fruits. Sideroxylon venulosum is typically found in coastal forests and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils.
